page.title: 02FARMING NEAR LYVEDEN
page.content: The main crops that are grown are barley , wheat and rape. Wheat is a very profitable crop to the farmer as it can be grown continuously and has a relatively low labour input. Oilseed rape has become an increasingly popular crop in this area and during the last few weeks of May the area is a mass of yellow. The farmers' reason for growing rape is that it is a very good break crop to follow milling wheat. After combining rape there is plenty of time to cultivate the land before sowing wheat etc. in October. Barley especially winter barley which yields better than spring barley , is grown as it is combined at the end of July so that rape which mostly follows can be sown at the end of August.
